instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V35_S3: What is PP1V35_S3? PP1V35_S3 is a 1.35v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - RAM Beep after short in <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message:
Logic board with no history. But perfect, without oxidation.

There was a short on the PPBus because of the <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced it, board turned on again, but with RAM beeping.

I have 1.35v on <SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL>, but when I test it off, it shows as a short (023.1), in 0.040 diode mode.

I compared it with another board, diode mode is 0.110 and there is no short on this line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - RAM Beep after short in <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message: RAM chips, or CPU damaged by overvoltage through <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - RAM Beep after short in <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>
threads.message: I imagined! Thank you very much!
